dtliExcerpt: The musical, starring Katie Brayben as the televangelist, is as generous and nonjudgmental as its subject, though it sometimes seems to mistake kindness for depth.
showScoreExcerpt: The musical, starring Katie Brayben as the televangelist, is as generous and nonjudgmental as its subject, though it sometimes seems to mistake kindness for depth.
nycTheatreExcerpt: "But narratively and emotionally, "Tammy Faye" is always on shaky ground because it can't decide if it's a satire of televangelism and power-hungry faith salesmen, the tale of the rise of politicized religion, or the earnest feminist journey of an independent-minded woman. By trying to hit so many notes, none of them resonate."
